@graph.rdfs:label: Comprehensive Review of Machine Learning and Deep Learning Methods for Biomedical Information Extraction (BioIE)
Systematic narrative review and taxonomic synthesis of >200 publications on learning-based BioIE methods (circa 2010–2017)

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Taxonomy and narrative synthesis of BioIE learning paradigms (supervised, semi-supervised, unsupervised, hybrid, OpenIE, deep learning)

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of feature engineering and feature selection approaches in supervised BioIE (lexical, syntactic, semantic, dependency, discourse, word embeddings)

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Summary of feature types and feature selection strategies in BioIE

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of kernel methods (tree kernels, graph kernels, MKL, hybrid kernels) applied to BioIE tasks

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Synthesis of kernel-based systems and multiple kernel learning in biomedical NER, PPI, DDI, and event extraction

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of annotation efficiency methods: pre-annotation, active learning, crowdsourcing (including CrowdTruth), and semi-automated tools (e.g., RapTAT)

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Overview of cost-reduction strategies for creating biomedical annotated corpora

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of unsupervised, semi-supervised (self-training, transfer learning, manifold regularization), and distant supervision approaches in BioIE

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Synthesis of methods leveraging unlabeled biomedical text (including DeepDive distant supervision applications)

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of hybrid (rule + ML ensemble) and joint modeling approaches (MLN, dual decomposition, SEARN, structured perceptron) for BioIE

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Summary of pipeline vs. joint inference strategies in biomedical event extraction and relation extraction

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of Open Information Extraction paradigms and their emerging application to biomedical text

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Comparison of Light vs. Heavy OpenIE extractors and biomedical adaptations (NELL adaptation, relation clustering)

@graph.rdfs:label: Review of deep learning applications in BioIE: word embeddings, CNNs, RNNs/LSTMs/GRUs, denoising autoencoders, transfer learning from vision, and clinical prediction

rdip:usedSoftware.schema:name: Deep learning frameworks (Theano, TensorFlow, CNTK, etc.) – implied but not named

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: State-of-the-art summary of deep neural architectures applied to biomedical NER, relation/event extraction, clinical prediction, and medical imaging

@graph.schema:name: Corpus of >200 cited publications on machine learning for BioIE (primarily 2010–2017)
@graph.schema:description: Includes references to CRF, SSVM, kernel methods, OpenIE systems, DeepDive, word2vec-era embeddings, early CNN/RNN papers in biomedicine

@graph.rdfs:label: Integration of all sub-reviews into final review manuscript section

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Final 'Methodology' review section of the paper
